author: Asa Fitch
title: Yemeni Forces Close In on Rebel-Held Port City
text:
Yemeni forces backed by a Saudi-led military coalition are closing in on the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah, a campaign that could prove a turning point in the war against the Houthis and a setback for Iranâ€™s interests in the country.
The military has swept to within about 12 miles of Hodeidah, the official Saudi Press Agency reported Tuesday, citing a coalition spokesman. Its successful capture could isolate the Houthi rebels and push them toward negotiations to end the more than three-year-old war.
